info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 28 at 8:19PM PDT until July 29 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 624, 625, 284, and 285... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 624, and 285... .An upper level trough offshore will bring gusty southwest winds and low daytime RH`s each afternoon and evening east of the Cascades and over far northeastern California through Sunday. Critically low RH`s and gusty winds are expected Saturday afternoon and evening. This includes gusts to 35 mph and RH`s in the single digits to mid teens. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 625... * AFFECTED AREA...In California...Fire weather zone 284 east of highway 97 and north of Tennant, including the Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge and Lava Beds National Monument. In Oregon...Fire Weather zone 625 for all areas south of a line from Summer Lake to Alkali Lake. * WIND...Southwest to west, 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...5 to 12 percent through the afternoon in zone 625, and 12 to 15 percent through the afternoon in zone 284. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Critical conditions may occur again Sunday afternoon in zone 625, but the forecast currently does not meet the duration criteria. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
